channel.title: LOOK! safezones LOOK!
channel.description:
well, my server is wild everywhere, i know how to do normal safezones but my method is a bit odd, it is like this:
PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY, 1) && IsInWilderness(absX, absY, 1)) || (duelFight))
&& (IsInWilderness(PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX, PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY, 1) && IsInWilderness(absX, absY, 1)) || (duelFight))
and it keeps doing that under each weapon attack method, please help!!

item.title: LOOK! safezones LOOK!
item.dc:creator: @marc_is_hood marc is hood
item.description:
@marc_is_hood wrote:

[quote=“Spyder, post:3, topic:3407”]Tutorial Name: Making Safe Zones, the easy way.

Purpose: Make it so people won’t attack in certain area’s.

Credits: Spyder

Difficulty: 2/10

Source Needed: Any

Files Editted: client.java

Open Client.java

Search for:

public boolean nonWild() { Or Search for:

nonwild or:

safezone You should see something like this:

public boolean nonWild() { if((absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3258 && absY >= 3438 && absY <=3431 ) || (absX >= 3039 && absX <= 3111 && absY >= 3475 && absY <=3523 ) || You need to add your own co-ords after the “||”.
So, add this:

(absX >=BotLeftX && absX <= TopRightX && absY >= BotLeftY && absY <=TopRightY ) || Now to edit the safe zone, continue below.

This is where we specify the areas that are nonwild.
How we do this is with X and Y Co-ordinates.

The whole process works in a square… literally.

Go to the bottom left corner of the safezone first. Write down the X and Y Co-ordinates.

Then go to the top right corner of the building. Get the X and Y Co-Ordinates of that corner.

Here is a picture on what it should look like:

Key:
BotLeftX = Bottom left hand corner X Co-ordinate
BotLeftY = Bottom left hand corner Y Co-ordinate

TopRightX = Top Right hand corner X Co-ordinate
TopRightY = Top Right hand corner Y Co-ordinate

||(absX >=BotLeftX && absX <= TopRightX && absY >= BotLeftY && absY <=TopRightY ) ||[/quote]Does this help? or is it just the same thing? I got it from Spyder from Runelocus.

Read full topic
